heading: binding UID
comment: A unique identifier for the binding, generated by concatenating the identifier given to the manuscript with which the binding is associated with a count of how many binding elements precede the current element in the entry file. In most cases, there is only one binding per manuscript.

heading: file URL
comment: Unique identifier for the catalogue file, given in the xml:id attribute to the TEI root element.

heading: collection
comment: The collection in which the manuscript is recorded, given in an idno element within the publicationStmt element which has @type "collection" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: msID
comment: The identifier given to the manuscript with which the binding is associated, given in an idno element within the publicationStmt element which has @type "msID" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: shelfmark
comment: The shelfmark given to the manuscript with which the binding is associated, given in an idno element within the publicationStmt element which has @type "shelfmark" and is not an alternative identifier (and therefore has no @subtype with "alt").

heading: binding
comment: Details of the binding as given in the binding element within the binding description, excluding details of the binding's condition and any decoration, which are given in columns BH and BJ respectively.

heading: condition
comment: Details of the condition of the binding as given in the condition element within the binding description.

heading: decoration
comment: Details of any decoration to the binding as given in decoNote elements within the binding description.

heading: contemporary
comment: A boolean (true/false) value expressing whether or not the binding is contemporary with the manuscript or manuscript part itself, as encoded within the @contemporary attribute to the binding element within the binding description.

heading: not after
comment: The date before which the binding was produced, formatted as a date, as encoded within the @notAfter element of the binding element within the binding description.

heading: not before
comment: The date after which the binding was produced, formatted as a date, as encoded within the @notBefore element of the binding element within the binding description.

heading: height
comment: The height of the binding, as encoded within the height element within a dimensions element with @type "binding", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: height max
comment: The maximum height of the binding, as encoded within the @max attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "binding", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no maximum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: height min
comment: The minimum height of the binding, as encoded within the @min attribute of the height element within a dimensions element with @type "binding", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no maximum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: width
comment: The width of the binding, as encoded within the width element within a dimensions element with @type "binding", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: width max
comment: The maximum width of the binding, as encoded within the @max attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "binding", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no maximum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: width min
comment: The minimum width of the binding, as encoded within the @min attribute of the width element within a dimensions element with @type "binding", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no minimum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: depth
comment: The depth of the binding, as encoded within the depth element within a dimensions element with @type "binding", contained within either the support or layout description. This value may or may not be numeric. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: depth max
comment: The maximum depth of the binding, as encoded within the @max attribute of the depth element within a dimensions element with @type "binding", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no maximum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: depth min
comment: The minimum depth of the binding, as encoded within the @min attribute of the depth element within a dimensions element with @type "binding", contained within either the support or layout description. This value is numeric. When no minimum value is present because the measurement does not contain a range, that non-range measurement is inherited. In many cases measurements may be rounded, for example to the nearest 5mm.

heading: unit
comment: The unit of the binding measurements, as encoded within the unit element of a dimensions element with @type "binding", within either the support or layout description. Common values are mm and in.
